settings.question: When are you launching?
settings.answer: Slugg will be open for business in April 2024! Sign up to be the first to know.

settings.question: Who is Slugg?
settings.answer: Slugg is the worlds first garden pot cluster company, started by an award winning Australian landscape design. We sell garden pots in sets of three. Each size has been carefully considered so the pots look stunning when grouped together. Or you can use them separately. Keen to learn more? Read the full story of Slugg.

settings.question: Why do you only sell pots in sets of three?
settings.answer: We believe things look better in threes. Designers call it the "law of threes". Why do garden pots look so good grouped in threes? Apparently, it's just the way our lovely brains work. We considered the size of every pot to make it as easy as possible for you to create the perfect pot cluster.

settings.question: What are the pots made from?
settings.answer: All Slugg garden pots are made from polyresin and fiberglass fibres. The pots are lightweight, waterproof and tougher than nails.

settings.question: Are they lightweight?
settings.answer: They sure are! The total weight of all three pots in a set of Sluggs is approx 30lbs. The pots may be lightweight, but they're also super strong. Much stronger than traditional concrete garden pots.

settings.question: Can I use them outside?
settings.answer: You sure can! Sluggs can be used outside or indoors.

settings.question: Do they have drainage holes?
settings.answer: Yes, each set of Slugg garden pots has 2 x 1 inch drainage holes in the base. This ensures the water can drain away to avoid soggy soil and wet feet. But I want to use my Sluggs inside, won't the water ruin my floors! Rest assured, we've got you covered. Simply add a set of pot trays to your order and say bye bye to messy spills.

settings.question: How do I use my Slugg pots?
settings.answer: Use this text to share the answer to the question with your customers.

settings.question: Can I purchase the pots individually?
settings.answer: Sluggs are sold in sets of three and can not be purchased individually. Lots of our wonderful customers use their Sluggs as standalone pots.

settings.question: Do I need a drainage kit?
settings.answer:
You only need a drainage kit if you plan on potting up your plants inside your Slugg pots. If you are simply placing the plants inside your Sluggs in the plants nursery pot, you do not need a drainage kit.

How do I use a drainage kit? To ensure excess water freely drains out the bottom of the pot, the pot needs to be slightly elevated off the ground with black plastic pot feet. To ensure the soil doesn't fall out the bottom of the two drainage holes, you simply place a piece of fiberglass flyscreen over the holes inside the pot. Each drainage kit includes 9 x black plastic pot feet and 3 x pieces of fiberglass flyscreen. You only need to purchase 1 x drainage kit per set of Sluggs.

settings.question: Do I need pot trays?
settings.answer: If you plan on using your Sluggs inside, we recommend placing a black plastic pot tray inside the base of each pot. This catches any excess water. Simply add a set of pot trays to your order and say bye bye to messy spills. Pot trays are designed to go inside the pots, not underneath them. Pot trays are only available in black.

settings.question: Should I pot up my plants?
What plants should I use?
settings.answer:
Not every plants thrive in all geographic locations which is why we recommend you chat with your local nursery or garden store to get the low-down on the best plants for your needs.

If you're looking for inspo, check out how some of our awesome customers have used their Sluggs - here.

settings.question: Is there somewhere I can see the pots in person?
settings.answer: Slugg is 100% online only. We've worked REALLY hard to get all the photos on our website as accurate as possible. If you're concerned about the true colour, we recommend viewing our product images on several different devices and screens just to be sure.

settings.question: How much is delivery?
settings.answer: Use this text to share the answer to the question with your customers.

settings.question: Do you offer returns?
settings.answer: Due to the fragile nature of shipping garden pots, we do not offer returns if you change your mind. If your Sluggs arrive damaged, we will happily send a replacement.

settings.question: How fast is delivery?
settings.answer: Orders placed before 1pm are dispatched the same business day. Orders placed after 1pm are dispatched next business day. Our distribution centre is located in Midland GA, so the time in transit depends on your location.

settings.question: Where do you deliver to?
settings.answer: We deliver to most of the United States. Some areas are excluded such as Alaska and Hawaii. Simply enter your address at checkout to find out if we deliver to your area.
